name: Achall

attributes.attribute: died of sorrow when Conall Cernach killed her brother, Erc
considered one of the six noblest women in Ireland because of her sisterly love

entities.type: ancient center of royal power in Ireland

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: An Ulster princess named Achall is renowned as an Irish heroine. Situated just east of Tara, the historical locus of Ireland's royal power, stands a hill named after this woman who perished of heartbreak when Conall Cernach took the life of her brother, Erc. She was regarded as one of the six most notable women of Ireland, thanks to her selfless devotion to her sibling.
